level.heading: Additional considerations for renewal of licenses.

level.text: If proper notice has been given, as provided in subchapter II of Chapter 4, and no objection to the appropriateness of the establishment is filed, the establishment shall be presumed to be appropriate for the locality, section, or portion of the District where it is located.

The Board shall consider the licensee's record of compliance with this title and the regulations promulgated under this title and any conditions placed on the license during the period of licensure, including the terms of a voluntary agreement.
The Board shall prepare a check sheet documenting the licensee's compliance. This check sheet shall be available to the public for review.

If an application for license renewal is made the subject of contested proceedings and the license expires before the Board's decision on the renewal application, the Board may extend the expiration date during the pendency of the decision on the renewal application.

level.heading: HISTORICAL AND STATUTORY NOTES
level.text: D.C. Law 13-298 amended and enacted into law Title 25 of the District of Columbia Official Code. The text of this section is derived from provisions formerly found in D.C. Code § 25-115(b)(1), (i). For notes from former § 25-115, see § 25-301.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For D.C. Law 13-298, see notes following § 25-101.
